metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3566 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SSL protocol 3.0, as used in OpenSSL through 1.0.1i and other products, uses nondeterministic CBC padding, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain cleartext data via a padding-oracle attack, aka the "POODLE" issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.17.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-source - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-source - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
No subscription required

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Bodo MÃ¶ller, Thai Duong, Krzysztof Kotowicz

notes.Note: mdeslaur> We recommend disabling SSLv3 on servers, if possible.  Community-provided information on disabling SSLv3 can be found here:  http://askubuntu.com/a/537196  SANS provided information on disabling SSLv3 can be found here: https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/POODLE+Turning+off+SSLv3+for+various+servers+and+client+/18837

criterions.comment: nss package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.17.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1').
openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
pound: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
